title: Defining Simplified Fraction
text: A fraction is considered simplified if there are no common factors in its numerator and denominator.

title: General Approach
text: Since it is hard to find all the common factors between the numerator and the denominator by observation, we will rewrite 69 and 120 as the product of primes and divide out the common factors from there.

title: Rewriting 69
text: What is 69 written as the product of primes?

title: Rewriting 120
text: What is 120 written as the product of primes?

title: Rewriting Fraction
text: Plug in the prime factoriazation of both the numerator and the denominator, we can rewrite the fraction as $$\frac{-\left(3\times23\right)}{2\times2\times2\times3\times5}$$.

title: Dividing Common Factors
text: We can now divide out the common factor 3 from both the top and the bottom, so we are left with the fraction $$\frac{-23}{2\times2\times2\times5}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Multiply the bottom. What simplified fraction do you get?
